newsitem.title: USA: CCC seeks U.S. HRW wheat for Armenia and Georgia.
newsitem.headline: CCC seeks U.S. HRW wheat for Armenia and Georgia.

text.p: Commodity Credit Corp said it was seeking up to 6,500 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better hard red winter wheat for donation to Armenia and 6,500 tonnes of U.S. HRW wheat for donation to Georgia.
Shipment was slated for Aug 20-Sept 8, according to CCC, which is part of U.S. Agriculture Department.
The wheat must originate in areas of the United States where Tilletia Indica (Karnal Bunt) is not known to occur.
Armenia was also seeking about 1,000 to 1,500 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better HRW wheat in bulk under the PL-480, Title I export program, its U.S. export agent said.
Delivery dates were set for Aug 20-Sept 8 and offers were due Aug 5, the agent said.
